comments: Horrible professor. First time teaching MGMT 449 and basically lied to the whole class with his grading system. Final project he gave me a 0 on my part of the project because he said the company is no longer in the industry... however the companys website states they were. He said he had proof and that hed send it to me, still hasnt. Dont take.

comments: Professor Consoli requires attendance, but shows online videos and reads all of his PowerPoints so his class was extremely boring. I am a student who can\'t learn with this teaching method. I definitely would not recommend this professor for MGMT340 as he is the worst professor I have encountered out of Orange Coast and CSUF.

comments: Teacher is: incredibly boring, doesnt know how to teach, & wastes time on videos & group activities that arent test conducive. Tests: come from the publisher, so why doesn\'t he use the online resources for the book that have practice quizzes? Got an A in the class only because A friend had the online resources and I was able to use them.

comments: weird class but i dont know, participation matters a lot, and turning homework. if you dont participate and turn in index cards, automatic 0/15% of you grade. Curves on exams a lot gives no lower than a C on exams if you fail. BUy the publisher test BLANK its pretty much the exam DONT BUY BOOK JUST THE TEST BLANK. all you need Multiple choice

comments: IRS career turned professor - He is by the book - BORING LECTURES - grades on a curve - tests are from text test bank, he doesn\'t write his own - study power points, no study guides - participation matters A LOT - turn in all assignments and index cards - weekly short paper - no late assignments - attendance is mandatory - shows good Ted Talks -

comments: You have to show up to this class as he is very particular on attendance and collects the homework at the start. Also you gotta participate as thats a hefty part of the grade. Theres a term paper and presentation that are both rather easy to do and leniently graded. He curves the tests and final both of which are directly from the publisher.

comments: Very arrogant. You can clearly tell he spent his entire life in the IRS. Most of the grade is 3 exams which are tough (uses a curve). Pretty easy 5-page team paper and presentation which he does not grade very hard on. Participation is NECESSARY for a high grade. Participate without using a note card? Expect 0 points. Avoid for 340 if possible.

comments: Gives bad feedback. Worst teaching style I\'ve ever seen. He makes his own notes verbatim to the book and reads them monotonously. He grades emotionally. If he doesn\'t like the subject you choose for your project personally he will grade it poorly. If he thinks you asked a dumb question he lets you know in front of entire class while laughing

comments: He reads off the pp and he uses his own life stories as examples. Don\'t take notes in class because he goes through them too fast and ends up posting them online. Lectures are boring so you end up daydreaming. Participation is 15% of your grade. Tests are passable. Had him for 2.5 hours. Majority of class was lecture, videos, group work.

comments: Professor John Consoli is an extremely approachable instructor. He is a very eloquent speaker and I learned a great amount about public speaking during the course of the semester. Without taking this course, my speaking skills would have remained at a low level. Mr. Consoli cares deeply about his students and only wishes success for them.

comments: This professor is the worst. He is not clear nor fair. His class is incredibly confusing. DONT TAKE HIM. AVOID THIS CLASS!!! He is not relatable and he is boring. Shows many Ted talk videos and speaks so fast you can\'t even take notes. It\'s hard to keep up with him. 5 quizzes 2 essays. Tough grader on essays. Hard to understand what he wants.

comments: Consoli is probably one of the worst professors I have taken from since I started CSUN. He gives quizzes every other week. During his lecture, he basically just writes his own notes and takes it word for word out of the book. He doesn\'t give very much instruction with the BSG game and doesn\'t help much with the paper. AVOID IF POSSIBLE!!

tag_professor: GROUP PROJECTS (8)  Participation matters (8)  Tough Grader (6)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  TEST HEAVY (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: 2 papers, 5 quizzes, 1 final, and participation. Mandatory is required and takes roll as if we\'re in elementary school. Quiz questions are vague and the discussions in class are redundant. The subject itself is interesting, but his bad attitude makes the class less than favorable. I would suggest taking a different professor if possible.

tag_professor: GROUP PROJECTS (8)  Participation matters (8)  Tough Grader (6)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  TEST HEAVY (2)  LECTURE HEAVY (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)
comments: There are 2 essays pretty easy, 5 quizes drops the lowest, no tests just a final, BOOKS are needed, and the only thing he grades hard on is "participation." Attendance is not mandatory but of course to participate and get points (out of 15pts) you must attend class. The work load is manageable, john makes you think critically overall a good class.
